result.execSummary:
The defendant Dionte J Nowels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).
  • Hit and Run-Involve Death, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample unless previously done, pay DNA surcharge.
DNA surcharge, all applicable Court costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.   DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts two and three, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: No direct or indirect contact with the victim's family.
Comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.
*Conditions of Extended Supervision are as to counts one, two and three.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one, consecutive to count three; and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one, consecutive to count two and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.
The Court will revoke defendant's ability to obtain a valid driver's license for a period of five (5) years as it relates to count three.

Per Order Dated August 9, 2019, Appeal No. 2018AP1171-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the motion is granted in part.  Defendant-appellant-petitioner shall have until September 13, 2019, to serve and file his supplemental petition for review in support of the no-merit petition for review filed on January 25, 2019. If the supplemental petition is not filed by September 13, 2019, this matter will be disposed of based solely on the petition filed by Attorney Sara Heinemann Roemaat.

Defendant Dionte J Nowels in court with attorney Sara H Roemaat.  Defendant Dionte J Nowels in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR

State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  
Closing arguments by state and defense.

Court placed on the record findings of fact and legal analysis. The Court DENIED Defense postconviction motion to withdraw pleas. Arguments heard as to defendant's motion to modify the length of the sentence imposed. Court DENIED the defense postconviction motion to modify the sentence imposed, for reasons placed on the record. The Court will issue a written order.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #3
Associated with Charge #2
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Dionte J Nowels in court with attorney Kathleen M. Quinn.  Defendant Dionte J Nowels in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by victim's fiancee, Leslie J. and defendant's brother, Andre C.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):   The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3-1/2 YEARS, concurrent to Counts 2 and 3, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving. 
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1-1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 25 YEARS, concurrent to Count 1, consecutive to Count 3, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving. 
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 15 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS, concurrent to Count 1, consecutive to Count 2, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving. 
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No direct or indirect contact with the victim's family.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges. The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
* The Court will REVOKE defendant's ability to obtain a valid driver's license for a period of 5 years as it relates to Count 3.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

On Behalf of Dionte's Family.

Defendant Dionte J Nowels in court with attorney Kathleen M. Quinn.  Defendant Dionte J Nowels in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 amended as follows:
Count #1 is AMENDED to: Operating Vehicle Without Owner's Consent [a Class I FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 943.23(3), 939.50(3)(i).

Count #s 2 and 3 remain as charged in the Original Information.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Parties request to adjourn the sentencing phase.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 03-25-2016 at 10:00 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED WITHOUT BAIL into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
